message: Bob, I'm offering you my product for $1,000,000. It's a great deal, considering its value to you. What do you think?
I appreciate your offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $900,000. I'm willing to make a serious commitment to purchase the product, but I need to stay within my budget.

Bob, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. I'm willing to come down to $950,000, but that's my final offer.  This product is truly unique and worth every penny. I'm confident you'll see the value in it.
I appreciate your persistence, but I'm still a bit short on budget. I'm willing to pay $850,000 for the product. That's the highest I can go.

Bob, I understand your budget constraints, but $850,000 is simply too low.  I'm willing to meet you halfway at $900,000. This is a one-time offer. If you're serious about acquiring this product, I encourage you to seriously consider it.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit short on budget. I'm willing to pay $875,000 for the product. That's the closest I can get to my target price.

Bob, I understand you're working within a budget, and I'm willing to make one final concession.  Let's close this deal at $890,000.  This is my absolute best offer, and I'm confident this product will be a valuable asset for you.  What do you say?
I appreciate your concession, but $890,000 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to pay $860,000 for the product. That's the closest I can get to my target price without going over.
